title: I want to read The Bhagavad Gita but I don't know Sanskrit and English is my second language. Is there any translation of The Holy Book in simple and plain English available? - Quora

response.answer_text: If this is your first time, you must read an edition which contains only LITERAL TRNSLATION OF THE VERSES AND NOTHING ELSE. Why? Bhagavat Gita is a work of poetry. In an amazingly elegent textbook of philosophy which might predate eveen Socrates, Plato and Aristotole. It is a research work that compiles (almost) all the prevailing faith and belief system at that time leading towards a surprising turn towatrds monoetheism - a feature never seen in Hinduism and Halenic Greek. It says that there is only one god and if you are sincere, no matter wahatever path you choose. Thus, containaing all the features of poetry surprisingly so similar to mothern modern poetry. Nobody can explain a modern poem. Just like a modern painting, and poetry Gita is also a poem written to be feelt by the observer/reader and not to be explained to others. It is an experience that is the readers’ very own, a private affair. Later, when you’ll be able to enrich your mind with the interpretation, you can read the modern “explainations” of Bhagavat Gita” which are not so “as it is” (“Explaination” and “as it is”? seriously, dude? Kill me!!)

Talks on Gita - by Acharya Vinoba Bhave It has explained all the verses of Gita in plain English but for some words you may have to refer dictionary else you can always use KINDLE app or KINDLE eBook reader :)
